greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Compound filter: a(n) = T(A046523(n), A109395(n)), where T(n,k) is sequence A000027 used as a pairing function.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[(2 + (#1 + #2)^2 - #1 - 3 #2)/2 & @@ {Times @@ MapIndexed[ Prime[First@ #2]^#1 &, Sort[FactorInteger[n][[All, -1]], Greater]] - Boole[n == 1], Denominator[EulerPhi[n]/n]}, {n, 73}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 04 2017 *)
program: A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ This function from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 17 2011
from sympy import factorint, totient, gcd
def T(n, m): return ((n + m)**2 - n - 3*m + 2)/2
return sorted([f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return T(a046523(n), n/gcd(n, totient(n))) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 05 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 04 2017
